all_paragraphs.text: SECTION 26 05 00
all_paragraphs.combined: SECTION 26 05 00

all_paragraphs.text: Common Work Results for Electrical
all_paragraphs.combined: Common Work Results for Electrical

all_paragraphs.text: GENERAL
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.0	GENERAL

all_paragraphs.text: SCOPE
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.01	SCOPE

all_paragraphs.text: A.	Division 26 includes all Specifications in the 26 00 00 Series and the accompanying Electrical Drawings.  Provide all labor, materials and equipment, and all necessary operations to provide the complete scope of the electrical systems intended under this Division.  Division 26 is not a stand alone document, but a part of the complete Project Documents.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	Division 26 includes all Specifications in the 26 00 00 Series and the accompanying Electrical Drawings.  Provide all labor, materials and equipment, and all necessary operations to provide the complete scope of the electrical systems intended under this Division.  Division 26 is not a stand alone document, but a part of the complete Project Documents.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Attention is called to the fact that there are many interfaces between the work required in this Division and the work required in other Divisions.  Provide the necessary interface and coordination with other Divisions to provide a complete project.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Attention is called to the fact that there are many interfaces between the work required in this Division and the work required in other Divisions.  Provide the necessary interface and coordination with other Divisions to provide a complete project.

all_paragraphs.text: EXISTING CONDITIONS
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.02	EXISTING CONDITIONS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	Attention is called to the fact that the work is to be performed within an existing, operational facility.  Prior to the submission of bids, each bidder shall visit the project site, thoroughly investigate and be familiar with all existing conditions, which will affect their work; especially the work to be performed above the existing ceilings.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	Attention is called to the fact that the work is to be performed within an existing, operational facility.  Prior to the submission of bids, each bidder shall visit the project site, thoroughly investigate and be familiar with all existing conditions, which will affect their work; especially the work to be performed above the existing ceilings.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	When this project is finished, the work under this Division shall be complete in every respect, completely integrated with all the existing systems, and left in perfect operating condition.  The electrical service to the building shall not be interrupted at any time without written coordination of the building's Owner.  All existing electrical equipment removed during the project shall be removed from the site after inspection of the building's Owner.  All existing electrical systems required to be operating at the project's completion or required to remain in use during the project shall be reconnected, replaced, rerouted or otherwise made to fit with proper workmanship techniques and left in safe working order.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	When this project is finished, the work under this Division shall be complete in every respect, completely integrated with all the existing systems, and left in perfect operating condition.  The electrical service to the building shall not be interrupted at any time without written coordination of the building's Owner.  All existing electrical equipment removed during the project shall be removed from the site after inspection of the building's Owner.  All existing electrical systems required to be operating at the project's completion or required to remain in use during the project shall be reconnected, replaced, rerouted or otherwise made to fit with proper workmanship techniques and left in safe working order.

all_paragraphs.text: C.	Connect new work to existing work in a neat and workmanlike manner.  Where an existing structure must be cut or existing utilities interfere, such obstructions shall be bypassed, removed, replaced or relocated, patched and repaired.  Work disturbed or damaged shall be replaced or repaired to its prior condition.
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	Connect new work to existing work in a neat and workmanlike manner.  Where an existing structure must be cut or existing utilities interfere, such obstructions shall be bypassed, removed, replaced or relocated, patched and repaired.  Work disturbed or damaged shall be replaced or repaired to its prior condition.

all_paragraphs.text: D.	Prior to the start of any demolition or construction, secure the services of a qualified, EPA Certified asbestos abatement agency to check the existing insulation, etc. for asbestos.  Should asbestos be found, do not proceed with demolition or construction; notify the Architect in any case in writing of the agency's findings.
all_paragraphs.combined: D.	Prior to the start of any demolition or construction, secure the services of a qualified, EPA Certified asbestos abatement agency to check the existing insulation, etc. for asbestos.  Should asbestos be found, do not proceed with demolition or construction; notify the Architect in any case in writing of the agency's findings.

all_paragraphs.text: CODES AND REGULATIONS
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.03	CODES AND REGULATIONS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	All work under this Division shall comply with all local building codes, laws, regulations, ordinances and the requirements of the 2023 National Electrical Code.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	All work under this Division shall comply with all local building codes, laws, regulations, ordinances and the requirements of the 2023 National Electrical Code.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Where conflicts of installation requirements occur between the aforementioned codes, regulations or the Contract Documents, the most restrictive shall govern.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Where conflicts of installation requirements occur between the aforementioned codes, regulations or the Contract Documents, the most restrictive shall govern.

all_paragraphs.text: C.	Obtain all permits and licenses and pay all fees required by local authorities.  Arrange for all necessary inspections required by the authorities having jurisdiction and provide written certificates of approval to the project Owner or his designated representative.
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	Obtain all permits and licenses and pay all fees required by local authorities.  Arrange for all necessary inspections required by the authorities having jurisdiction and provide written certificates of approval to the project Owner or his designated representative.

all_paragraphs.text: DEFINITIONS
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.04	DEFINITIONS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	Contract Documents:  The complete set of project Drawings and Specifications.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	Contract Documents:  The complete set of project Drawings and Specifications.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Provide:  Furnish, install and connect.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Provide:  Furnish, install and connect.

all_paragraphs.text: C.	Work:  All materials installed, including all labor to provide complete system.
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	Work:  All materials installed, including all labor to provide complete system.

all_paragraphs.text: D.	Wiring or Wired:  All wire or cable installed in conduit from panelboard to equipment and connected at both ends with all required boxes, connectors, couplings, etc.
all_paragraphs.combined: D.	Wiring or Wired:  All wire or cable installed in conduit from panelboard to equipment and connected at both ends with all required boxes, connectors, couplings, etc.

all_paragraphs.text: E.	Conduit:  Rigid steel conduit intermediate metal conduit (I.M.C.), electrical metallic tubing (EMT) plastic conduit (PVC), electrical non-metal tubing (ENT), or flexible steel conduit.
all_paragraphs.combined: E.	Conduit:  Rigid steel conduit intermediate metal conduit (I.M.C.), electrical metallic tubing (EMT) plastic conduit (PVC), electrical non-metal tubing (ENT), or flexible steel conduit.

all_paragraphs.text: DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.05	DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	The Drawings and Specifications together are to be considered as the Contract Documents. Any work shown in one and not shown in the other, or implied by either, shall be provided to give a complete project.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	The Drawings and Specifications together are to be considered as the Contract Documents. Any work shown in one and not shown in the other, or implied by either, shall be provided to give a complete project.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Should any conflicts exist between the Drawings and Specifications or there is an item shown/called for which is not clearly defined, immediately submit a request for clarification.  No additional monies will be granted later when a conflict is resolved or an item is more clearly defined.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Should any conflicts exist between the Drawings and Specifications or there is an item shown/called for which is not clearly defined, immediately submit a request for clarification.  No additional monies will be granted later when a conflict is resolved or an item is more clearly defined.

all_paragraphs.text: C.	The Drawings are schematic and are not intended to show the exact location outlets, etc. or the routing of conduit.
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	The Drawings are schematic and are not intended to show the exact location outlets, etc. or the routing of conduit.

all_paragraphs.text: D.	The exact location of equipment requiring electrical connections (mechanical equipment, elevators, lights, etc.) shall be as located by other Divisions of the Contract Documents. Refer to the Architectural, Structural and Mechanical Documents for dimensions and details of building construction and provide work described in this Division so that it conforms to the details of the project.  The right is reserved to relocate any receptacle, switch or other outlet a maximum of 10'-0" before it is permanently installed without incurring additions to the Contract amount.
all_paragraphs.combined: D.	The exact location of equipment requiring electrical connections (mechanical equipment, elevators, lights, etc.) shall be as located by other Divisions of the Contract Documents. Refer to the Architectural, Structural and Mechanical Documents for dimensions and details of building construction and provide work described in this Division so that it conforms to the details of the project.  The right is reserved to relocate any receptacle, switch or other outlet a maximum of 10'-0" before it is permanently installed without incurring additions to the Contract amount.

all_paragraphs.text: SITE VISIT
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.06	SITE VISIT

all_paragraphs.text: A.	Visit the site and become familiar with all aspects of the site and existing conditions before submitting Contract price.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	Visit the site and become familiar with all aspects of the site and existing conditions before submitting Contract price.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	No allowance will be made for lack of knowledge of existing conditions.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	No allowance will be made for lack of knowledge of existing conditions.

all_paragraphs.text: DEVIATIONS
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.07	DEVIATIONS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	No deviations from the Contract Documents shall be made without the full knowledge and written consent of the Architect.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	No deviations from the Contract Documents shall be made without the full knowledge and written consent of the Architect.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	If the existing conditions make it desirable to modify the Contract Documents in regard to any item, provide a written request to the Architect.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	If the existing conditions make it desirable to modify the Contract Documents in regard to any item, provide a written request to the Architect.

all_paragraphs.text: 2.0	PRODUCTS
all_paragraphs.combined: 2.0	PRODUCTS

all_paragraphs.text: 2.01	STANDARDS FOR MATERIALS AND WORKMANSHIP
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.01	2.01	STANDARDS FOR MATERIALS AND WORKMANSHIP

all_paragraphs.text: A.	All materials used shall be new and shall be stamped with the label of Underwriters Laboratories, Inc. (UL), or other approved third-party listing agency.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	All materials used shall be new and shall be stamped with the label of Underwriters Laboratories, Inc. (UL), or other approved third-party listing agency.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	All materials shall meet the standards of the following associations and institutes where applicable:
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	All materials shall meet the standards of the following associations and institutes where applicable:

all_paragraphs.text: 1.	National Fire Protection Association (NFPA)
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.	National Fire Protection Association (NFPA)

all_paragraphs.text: 2.	American Society of Testing Materials (ASTM)
all_paragraphs.combined: 2.	American Society of Testing Materials (ASTM)

all_paragraphs.text: 3.	American National Standards Institute (ANSI)
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.	American National Standards Institute (ANSI)

all_paragraphs.text: 4.	National Electrical Manufacturer's Association (NEMA)
all_paragraphs.combined: 4.	National Electrical Manufacturer's Association (NEMA)

all_paragraphs.text: 5.	Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE)
all_paragraphs.combined: 5.	Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE)

all_paragraphs.text: 6.	National Electrical Installation Standards (NECA)
all_paragraphs.combined: 6.	National Electrical Installation Standards (NECA)

all_paragraphs.text: C.	Manufacturer’s names and catalog numbers specified herein are intended to describe the material and set the standard of quality. All bids shall be based on material specified.  Requests for approval of material not specified shall be considered if the request is in written form and submitted to the Architect no later than fourteen (14) days before bid date.  All requests shall conform with the provisions of the general and supplementary conditions. If alternate/substitute equipment is submitted, it is the contractors responsibility to provide redesign required in order to make, a code compliant, complete working system.
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	Manufacturer’s names and catalog numbers specified herein are intended to describe the material and set the standard of quality. All bids shall be based on material specified.  Requests for approval of material not specified shall be considered if the request is in written form and submitted to the Architect no later than fourteen (14) days before bid date.  All requests shall conform with the provisions of the general and supplementary conditions. If alternate/substitute equipment is submitted, it is the contractors responsibility to provide redesign required in order to make, a code compliant, complete working system.

all_paragraphs.text: D.	Samples of materials requested to be substituted shall be furnished upon the request of the Architect.
all_paragraphs.combined: D.	Samples of materials requested to be substituted shall be furnished upon the request of the Architect.

all_paragraphs.text: 2.02	SHOP DRAWINGS AND SUBMITTAL
all_paragraphs.combined: 2.02	SHOP DRAWINGS AND SUBMITTAL

all_paragraphs.text: A.	The Engineer's review of shop drawings or submittals is a cursory review to check for general compliances of submittals with the design intent of the Contract Documents.  The Engineer's review does not relieve the Contractor of his responsibility of complying with the Contract Documents.  All coordination of the work in strict compliance with the Contract Documents is the sole responsibility of the Contractor.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	The Engineer's review of shop drawings or submittals is a cursory review to check for general compliances of submittals with the design intent of the Contract Documents.  The Engineer's review does not relieve the Contractor of his responsibility of complying with the Contract Documents.  All coordination of the work in strict compliance with the Contract Documents is the sole responsibility of the Contractor.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	The following items shall be submitted for review:
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	The following items shall be submitted for review:

all_paragraphs.text: Conduit and wire
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.	Conduit and wire

all_paragraphs.text: Grounding system
all_paragraphs.combined: 2.	Grounding system

all_paragraphs.text: Devices
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.	Devices

all_paragraphs.text: Coverplates
all_paragraphs.combined: 4.	Coverplates

all_paragraphs.text: Under floor duct
all_paragraphs.combined: 5.	Under floor duct

all_paragraphs.text: Metering equipment
all_paragraphs.combined: 6.	Metering equipment

all_paragraphs.text: Panelboards
all_paragraphs.combined: 7.	Panelboards

all_paragraphs.text: Switchboards
all_paragraphs.combined: 8.	Switchboards

all_paragraphs.text: Transformers
all_paragraphs.combined: 9.	Transformers

all_paragraphs.text: Fuses
all_paragraphs.combined: 10.	Fuses

all_paragraphs.text: Overcurrent devices
all_paragraphs.combined: 11.	Overcurrent devices

all_paragraphs.text: Busway
all_paragraphs.combined: 12.	Busway

all_paragraphs.text: Ground fault system
all_paragraphs.combined: 13.	Ground fault system

all_paragraphs.text: Disconnect switches
all_paragraphs.combined: 14.	Disconnect switches

all_paragraphs.text: Lighting fixtures
all_paragraphs.combined: 15.	Lighting fixtures

all_paragraphs.text: Lighting control system
all_paragraphs.combined: 16.	Lighting control system

all_paragraphs.text: Dimming system
all_paragraphs.combined: 17.	Dimming system

all_paragraphs.text: Life safety system
all_paragraphs.combined: 18.	Life safety system

all_paragraphs.text: Emergency system
all_paragraphs.combined: 19.	Emergency system

all_paragraphs.text: Motor starters
all_paragraphs.combined: 20.	Motor starters

all_paragraphs.text: Motor control center
all_paragraphs.combined: 21.	Motor control center

all_paragraphs.text: Surge Protective Devices
all_paragraphs.combined: 22.	Surge Protective Devices

all_paragraphs.text: Lightning Protection System
all_paragraphs.combined: 23.	Lightning Protection System

all_paragraphs.text: C.	All shop drawings and submittals shall be submitted in compliance with the requirements of the general and supplementary conditions. All submittals are to be received electronically in .pdf format only.
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	All shop drawings and submittals shall be submitted in compliance with the requirements of the general and supplementary conditions. All submittals are to be received electronically in .pdf format only.

all_paragraphs.text: D.	All submittals shall bear the name of the manufacturer to be used. All selections to be made for product options critical to design.
all_paragraphs.combined: D.	All submittals shall bear the name of the manufacturer to be used. All selections to be made for product options critical to design.

all_paragraphs.text: E.	All shop drawings and submittals shall include a stamped indication signifying that the submittal has been reviewed for compliance with the Contract Documents by the Electrical and General Contractors.  This stamped indication also represents the fact that the Contractor has checked this submittal for its interaction with all other Divisions and certifies by his signature or initials that all coordination has taken place.  The stamp shall include the date, name of the Contracting Firm, the signature of the Contractor, certification of compliance and approval.  This stamp shall be on the submittal before the Engineer will review it.
all_paragraphs.combined: E.	All shop drawings and submittals shall include a stamped indication signifying that the submittal has been reviewed for compliance with the Contract Documents by the Electrical and General Contractors.  This stamped indication also represents the fact that the Contractor has checked this submittal for its interaction with all other Divisions and certifies by his signature or initials that all coordination has taken place.  The stamp shall include the date, name of the Contracting Firm, the signature of the Contractor, certification of compliance and approval.  This stamp shall be on the submittal before the Engineer will review it.

all_paragraphs.text: F.	The engineer will review an individual submittal not more than twice.  If the submittal is rejected again on the second review, the contractor will bare all responsibility for paying for the engineer's time for additional reviews.  Such payments to the engineer shall be withheld from the next monthly pay application.
all_paragraphs.combined: F.	The engineer will review an individual submittal not more than twice.  If the submittal is rejected again on the second review, the contractor will bare all responsibility for paying for the engineer's time for additional reviews.  Such payments to the engineer shall be withheld from the next monthly pay application.

all_paragraphs.text: G. submittal to be dated upon creation. Engineer to have at least one (1) working week of review time.
all_paragraphs.combined: G. submittal to be dated upon creation. Engineer to have at least one (1) working week of review time.

all_paragraphs.text: 2.03	RECORD (AS-BUILT) DRAWINGS AND MAINTENANCE MANUALS
all_paragraphs.combined: 2.03	RECORD (AS-BUILT) DRAWINGS AND MAINTENANCE MANUALS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	At job completion, submit to the Architect, a set of prints showing all deviations from the Contract Documents.  The Drawings shall also have dimensions locating all underground conduits.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	At job completion, submit to the Architect, a set of prints showing all deviations from the Contract Documents.  The Drawings shall also have dimensions locating all underground conduits.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	At job completion, submit to the Architect, color .pdf format document of maintenance, instruction manuals, final submittals, record shop drawings and sequence of operations for all equipment/systems furnished on the project. Confirm with owner if hard copies are required.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	At job completion, submit to the Architect, color .pdf format document of maintenance, instruction manuals, final submittals, record shop drawings and sequence of operations for all equipment/systems furnished on the project. Confirm with owner if hard copies are required.

all_paragraphs.text: 3.0	EXECUTION
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.0	EXECUTION

all_paragraphs.text: 3.01	COORDINATION
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.01	COORDINATION

all_paragraphs.text: A.	Coordinate all space requirements with all other Divisions before installing any work.  Install work such that adequate space will be allotted for all other work from other Divisions to be installed and also will allow room for future access for repair and maintenance.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	Coordinate all space requirements with all other Divisions before installing any work.  Install work such that adequate space will be allotted for all other work from other Divisions to be installed and also will allow room for future access for repair and maintenance.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Any work installed without proper coordination shall be relocated at the Architect's direction without increasing the contract price.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Any work installed without proper coordination shall be relocated at the Architect's direction without increasing the contract price.

all_paragraphs.text: C.	During the bidding process or the pricing for a guaranteed maximum price, coordinate with all other Divisions for the total amount of work required in Division 26, as well as, any alternate equipment that would cause deviations in the contract price.  Any work shown or implied in another Division requiring work in Division 26 shall be included in the contract price regardless of whether or not it is addressed in Division 26.
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	During the bidding process or the pricing for a guaranteed maximum price, coordinate with all other Divisions for the total amount of work required in Division 26, as well as, any alternate equipment that would cause deviations in the contract price.  Any work shown or implied in another Division requiring work in Division 26 shall be included in the contract price regardless of whether or not it is addressed in Division 26.

all_paragraphs.text: 3.02	PROTECTION OF MATERIALS
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.02	PROTECTION OF MATERIALS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	All equipment shall have the original finish when the building is turned over to the Owner.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	All equipment shall have the original finish when the building is turned over to the Owner.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Protect equipment during construction from dirt, water, chemical, mechanical damage, etc.  Protect all conduit openings so that no foreign material will enter the conduit.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Protect equipment during construction from dirt, water, chemical, mechanical damage, etc.  Protect all conduit openings so that no foreign material will enter the conduit.

all_paragraphs.text: 3.03	TESTS, DEMONSTRATION AND INSTRUCTIONS
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.03	TESTS, DEMONSTRATION AND INSTRUCTIONS

all_paragraphs.text: A.	Functional Testing:
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	Functional Testing:

all_paragraphs.text: Test all systems described in this Division in the presence of the Owner or a designated representative upon completion of the work.  Demonstrate that the installation is in accordance with Contract Documents.
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.	Test all systems described in this Division in the presence of the Owner or a designated representative upon completion of the work.  Demonstrate that the installation is in accordance with Contract Documents.

all_paragraphs.text: For all new lighting ad lighting control systems within the contract documents, the contractor shall obtain the service of a licensed professional engineer (registered in the state this project is within) to perform system commissioning in compliance with local energy conservation codes. The contractor shall demonstrate in the presence of the commissioning agent that the installation of such systems are in accordance with the contract documents.
all_paragraphs.combined: 2.	For all new lighting ad lighting control systems within the contract documents, the contractor shall obtain the service of a licensed professional engineer (registered in the state this project is within) to perform system commissioning in compliance with local energy conservation codes. The contractor shall demonstrate in the presence of the commissioning agent that the installation of such systems are in accordance with the contract documents.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Any work found not to be in compliance with the Contract Documents shall be repaired or replaced without incurring any additions to the Contract price.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Any work found not to be in compliance with the Contract Documents shall be repaired or replaced without incurring any additions to the Contract price.

all_paragraphs.text: C.	Provide to the Owner, all instruction on maintenance and operation of all systems and equipment provided under this Division.  Provide all necessary tools and personnel to thoroughly present these instructions. The documentation shall include the following, at a minimum:
all_paragraphs.combined: C.	Provide to the Owner, all instruction on maintenance and operation of all systems and equipment provided under this Division.  Provide all necessary tools and personnel to thoroughly present these instructions. The documentation shall include the following, at a minimum:

all_paragraphs.text: Submittal data including all selected options.
all_paragraphs.combined: 1.	Submittal data including all selected options.

all_paragraphs.text: Operation and maintenance manual for all equipment and systems, Include routine maintenance actions and cleaning procedures.
all_paragraphs.combined: 2.	Operation and maintenance manual for all equipment and systems, Include routine maintenance actions and cleaning procedures.

all_paragraphs.text: A schedule for inspecting and recalibrating, where applicable.
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.	A schedule for inspecting and recalibrating, where applicable.

all_paragraphs.text: A narrative of how each system is intended to operate including any recommended set points where adjustment is available.
all_paragraphs.combined: 4.	A narrative of how each system is intended to operate including any recommended set points where adjustment is available.

all_paragraphs.text: D.	At project completion, prior to obtaining Certificate of Occupancy, present at final inspection to the jurisdiction AHJ a signed and dated statement of system commissioning for all lighting and lighting control systems. The format of the statement of system commissioning shall be in the format of the state’s energy conservations codes and/or AHJ requirements. The document shall be signed by the contractor’s licensed professional representative.
all_paragraphs.combined: D.	At project completion, prior to obtaining Certificate of Occupancy, present at final inspection to the jurisdiction AHJ a signed and dated statement of system commissioning for all lighting and lighting control systems. The format of the statement of system commissioning shall be in the format of the state’s energy conservations codes and/or AHJ requirements. The document shall be signed by the contractor’s licensed professional representative.

all_paragraphs.text: 3.04	GUARANTEE
all_paragraphs.combined: 3.04	GUARANTEE

all_paragraphs.text: A.	All systems, equipment, components, work, etc. provided under this Division shall be covered by a one year guarantee starting at the time of final acceptance of the work by the Owner.  Any defects in the work, systems, equipment or components found during this year shall be corrected at no charge.  The guarantee shall include providing all necessary cutting, patchwork, repainting, etc. to make the work complete and new.
all_paragraphs.combined: A.	All systems, equipment, components, work, etc. provided under this Division shall be covered by a one year guarantee starting at the time of final acceptance of the work by the Owner.  Any defects in the work, systems, equipment or components found during this year shall be corrected at no charge.  The guarantee shall include providing all necessary cutting, patchwork, repainting, etc. to make the work complete and new.

all_paragraphs.text: B.	Present this guarantee and any additional warranties or guarantees on furnished equipment or systems to the Architect.  All equipment or system guarantees are in addition to the general guarantee.
all_paragraphs.combined: B.	Present this guarantee and any additional warranties or guarantees on furnished equipment or systems to the Architect.  All equipment or system guarantees are in addition to the general guarantee.

all_paragraphs.text: END OF SECTION
all_paragraphs.combined: END OF SECTION
